meanings.definition: A sudden gush or burst of something
meanings.sent1: The water spurted out of the fountain.
meanings.sent2: I saw a spurt of oil coming out of the machine.
meanings.sent3: The soda can spurted when I opened it too quickly.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a spurt of joy in the room.
meanings.sent5: The burst of confetti created a colorful spurt in the air.

meanings.definition: To gush or burst out in a sudden stream
meanings.sent1: The hose spurted water all over the garden.
meanings.sent2: The volcano spurted lava into the sky.
meanings.sent3: The excited puppy spurted out of the door when it was opened.
meanings.sent4: Emotions can spurt out unexpectedly like a shaken soda can.
meanings.sent5: The music spurted out of the speakers, filling the room with sound.

meanings.definition: A brief period of intense effort or activity
meanings.sent1: During the game, he had a spurt of energy and scored a goal.
meanings.sent2: She had a spurt of creativity and painted a beautiful picture.
meanings.sent3: The spurt of cleaning before guests arrive is always hectic.
meanings.sent4: The spurt of studying before the exam paid off with a good grade.
meanings.sent5: The spurt of applause after the performance showed appreciation from the audience.
